messages.title: It's time for real change
messages.content: Local champion Nick Chisholm is standing for Labour at the General Election on 12 December- pledging to deliver the real change Upper Nithsdale needs.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: By supporting a People’s vote to give local people a final say between a credible deal and remain. I will continue to campaign for remain.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: End the cuts to schools and our NHS
keyPolicies.policyDescription: By investing an extra £70 bn for Scotland.

personalStories.story: Nick has lived in Dumfriesshire for over 20 years and his children attend local schools. He has worked on a range of local environmental projects, helping tackle climate change and creating jobs in the area.

examples: He believes local people are angry by our MPs neglect for austerity that has led to cuts to schools and hospitals
This election is a clear choice between more cuts with a Boris Johnson Conservative Government or a Labour Government that will deliver real change and a better future.
Nick added, “Our former mining communities in Upper Nithsdale are forgotten about by Government, whether it is the SNP in Edinburgh or Tories in London.”
There is no route to a Labour Government by voting SNP or Lib Dem. The only way to get the Tories out of Number 10 is to vote Labour.
